channel.title: PHP for beginners!
channel.description:
Table of Contents: MAIN: Installing PHP. MAIN 2: Setting up PHP page. Part 1: Simple "hello world" Part 2: The if statement Part 3: elseif and else statements Part 4: Switch statements Part 5: Forms POST and GET Part 6: Loops Part 7: Font effects Part 8: Arrays Part 9: Variables
[b]MAIN:[/b] coming tomorrow with pictures (on iPhone right now so can't really do it...)
[b]MAIN 2:[/b] In a PHP document much like you would to an ordinary HTML document you start the page off like this <?php and end the page off like this ?>
[b]Part One[/b] the hello world program is the most easiest for newcomers to learn so let's begin off here, to have your page say Hello world simply put the following [code]echo"Hello World";[/code] what this does... Echo means that it will display what ever is in the quotes. In this case Hello World..
[b]Question[/b] what would the following give me? Echo"Moparscape.org"; Answers below...
[b]Part 2:[/b] The if statement this is something that is used a lot in PHP scripting, the if statement says if a condition then do it, and example would be if I had 5 dollars and a shirt costed 6 I could create an if statement like this. [code] If(5<6){ echo"You do not have enough money!"; } [/code] so if 5 is less than 6 I don't have enough money to buy the shirt :(
More coming tomorrow, I don't want to keep typing on iPhone, will finish tomorrow morning

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No tutorials unless they are especially approved afaik (newbie here), and as this post does not give any special information that cannot be found in all Level 1 PHP tutorials, I’ll lock this.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I know that, but I was tying statement / method together. Sorry for the misunderstanding.

Though;[quote author=I Vain I link=topic=498976.msg3649535#msg3649535 date=1309636267]
Would the ‘if()’ statement be case sensitive, or insensitive?
[/quote][/quote]

Nope, just tried it in wampserver, seems to work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=498976.msg3648928#msg3648928 date=1309580265]
Where’s the tags at, I don’t think you capitalize If
[/quote]in php, methods are case-insensitive

[php]echo ‘hello’;
eChO ‘hello’;
ECHO ‘hello’;
[/php]
would all print ‘hello’

however, variables are case-sesitive so:
[php]$name;
$nAmE;
$NAME;
[/php]
are all three different variables.[/quote]

the if statement isn’t a method idiot

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Good_Memory Good Memory
item.description:
@Good_Memory wrote:

My iPhone auto capitalized it and I didn’t even notice my bad
And ops sorry I didn’t know that was a rule

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=498976.msg3648928#msg3648928 date=1309580265]
Where’s the tags at, I don’t think you capitalize If
[/quote]in php, methods are case-insensitive

[php]echo ‘hello’;
eChO ‘hello’;
ECHO ‘hello’;
[/php]
would all print ‘hello’

however, variables are case-sesitive so:
[php]$name;
$nAmE;
$NAME;
[/php]
are all three different variables.[/quote]

I know, just pointing out it’s easier just to do lowercase.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Where’s the tags at, I don’t think you capitalize If

<?php $age = $_GET['age']; if($age > 13) { echo "Over 13."; } else { echo "Under 13." } ?>

Read full topic

item.title: PHP for beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Good_Memory Good Memory
item.description:
@Good_Memory wrote:

Table of Contents:
MAIN: Installing PHP.
MAIN 2: Setting up PHP page.
Part 1: Simple “hello world”
Part 2: The if statement
Part 3: elseif and else statements
Part 4: Switch statements
Part 5: Forms POST and GET
Part 6: Loops
Part 7: Font effects
Part 8: Arrays
Part 9: Variables

MAIN:
coming tomorrow with pictures (on iPhone right now so can’t really do it…)

MAIN 2:
In a PHP document much like you would to an ordinary HTML document you start the page off like this <?php and end the page off like this ?>

Part One
the hello world program is the most easiest for newcomers to learn so let’s begin off here, to have your page say Hello world simply put the following

what this does… Echo means that it will display what ever is in the quotes. In this case Hello World…

Question
what would the following give me?
Echo"Moparscape.org";
Answers below…

Part 2:
The if statement this is something that is used a lot in PHP scripting, the if statement says if a condition then do it, and example would be if I had 5 dollars and a shirt costed 6 I could create an if statement like this.

If(5<6){
echo"You do not have enough money!";
}

so if 5 is less than 6 I don’t have enough money to buy the shirt

More coming tomorrow, I don’t want to keep typing on iPhone, will finish tomorrow morning

Read full topic
